clues.text: "And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people"
"Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall"
In chapter 20 "and death and hell were cast into the lake of fire"
"The seventh day is the Sabbath of rest, an holy convocation; ye shall do no work therein"; sorry, college & pro football players!
"Out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice"
Lifelong Catholic Alexander Pope received these prayers & sacraments the day before his death
Allan was the first name of this Scottish-born founder of an American detective agency
In 1923 suffragist Alice Paul drafted & had introduced into Congress the first version of this proposed amendment
General A.P. Hill led reserve troops on a forced march to save a Confederate Army from destruction at this gory 1862 battle
Alexander Pushkin dramatized Russian history in this play about a 17th century czar
People of this sign tend to be chatty, like early June babies Anderson Cooper & Amy Schumer, who make their living talking
Think of the 4-letter acronym describing Muhammad Ali & it makes sense this was his sign
Fans of Malibu beaches & TV's "The Cisco Kid" know this first name of actor Carrillo, matching his sign
It's your sign if, like Logan Paul, your birthday is on a day noted for pranks
Always seeing both sides equally, it's "the diplomat of the zodiac" & was the sign of Ebenezer Bassett, the USA's first Black diplomat
Carroll's preface to this sequel includes a chess problem that underlies the book's action
This playwright had his character Tom Wingfield speak directly to the audience as a prologue
An 1850 preface says this British novel "was hewn in a wild workshop... the statuary found a granite block on a solitary moor"
His intro to "Nobody Knows my Name": "In America, the color of my skin had stood between myself & me; in Europe, that barrier was down"
This poem has a general prologue that introduces the pilgrims, beginning with the Knight
In 2022 the perfectly preserved remains of a 30,000-year-old baby one of these tusked animals were discovered in the Yukon
The oldest person in the Bible, Methuselah lived to this ripe old palindromic age
The paintings discovered in this French cave Sept. 12, 1940 likely date to the Upper Paleolithic period
Completed in 1345 this bridge that spans the Arno River in Florence has a name meaning "old bridge"
Founded in 1764 this New England newspaper is the oldest continuously published paper in America
This suburb of Cairo is home to a zoo; the University of Cairo moved there in 1924
In 2004 this city's airport was renamed to honor Lech Walesa
Lake Tiberias is another name for it
This town in Somerset is said to be the burial place of Queen Guinevere
This city on the Mur River is the second-largest in Austria
In the 1950s a Procter & Gamble employee gave his lavish attention to coming up with this disposable diaper & it launched in 1961
The bilingual book "Besos for Baby" teaches tots Spanish words like besos, meaning these
This subsidiary of Mattel made up of 2 last names sells every kind of toy, including the kitchen sink
Give your baby a good night's sleep with this type of machine, or just read the same-named Don DeLillo novel
Buy the tot a plush baby JJ, a character from this YouTube show with a fruit in its name
Amendments to bills not relevant to the legislation are deemed these, like passengers in cars or people on horseback
Nonprofits that spend to influence elections don't need to disclose donors & are thereby using this "money"
This agricultural term for a political movement involving the common person also just means basic or foundational
Hellenic & Long Island Sound are 2 of these smaller groups of legislators that meet to promote a common agenda
It's a bird, it's a plane, no, it's this specified level of support needed to pass a vote, usually 3/5 in the Senate
A deep-dish fruit pie with no bottom crust, or a shoemaker
To go on complaining about something, or a big freshwater fish that can live for nearly 50 years
An unbranded range animal, or a politician who doesn't toe the party line
A bent posture, or where Hannah & her besties sometimes hung out on "Girls"
It means eagerly hopeful or related to blood
Hemolytic, iron-deficiency & pernicious are just 3 types of this blood disorder
This condition is a symptom of yellow fever & the source of its name
This disease is the increase in pressure in the eye due to blockage of the aqueous humor
The name of this disease means "hard skin", but it can also affect internal organs
PCOS is short for this syndrome that may interfere with a woman's menstrual cycle
Bungee jumping is one activity that will give you this type of "rush"
A November 2024 outbreak of this was linked to cucumbers, causing a recall
This synonym for surrender comes from Latin for "little head"
How perfect that this word for a solid figure with 10 faces has 10 letters
For the title of a memoir, Gore Vidal used this fancy word for a manuscript in which layers of writing are superimposed
Gifts are 100% deductible as this U.N. agency is "relentlessly pursuing a better world for every child"
Over 400,000 die of this preventable disease every year, with 70% being kids under 5; "Against" it buys $2 nets that can save those lives
Sarah McLachlan said her incredibly sad ads for this worthy charity are "brutal" (oof yes) but that's to "bring the wallet out" (please do!)
Each year this organization founded in 1944 awards scholarships worth more than $65 million as it aids 37 HBCUs
Founded by veterans & friends in 2003, WWP, short for this, says "the greatest casualty is being forgotten"

rounds.text: This TV show that debuted in 1960 licensed its name 8 years later to a childrens' health product that's still around today
